did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Discusses an article about New Orleanswhich she promised him by May 1; says it will be delayed due to problems with photographs.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Sends him article on New OrleansCreoles with photographs; instructs him on how much to pay the woman photographer and to give credit in publication of photographs to "Washburn" who took the pictures of the three beauties; states that her fee is $200.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Acknowledges check; hopes he is pleased with the article; says she is willing to make corrections if necessary and would like to have the proofs; requests proof of his planned article on her life; suggests future article on the Acadians, "Cajuns," of Louisiana. ]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Sends him just finished humorous sketch; asks to be sent proofs for correction, if he likes it; gives her new address.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Offers a humorous Christmas story which exceeds the five thousand word limit a little; asks for a quick decision; intends to offer it to another editor in time for Christmas should Bok reject it.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Says she is pleased at acceptance of the manuscript, but expected $300 for it and is sure a mistake has been made; promises more work for him in the future.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Says the Christmas story will be included in a collection of short stories to be published by Harper's; asks permission to use Bok's illustrations; promises to send him a manuscript soon.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Says that her sister, Sarah McEnery, is living temporarily in Holland, plans to write a series of articles on Holland towns, picture galleries, etc. for publication; attempts to get Bok interested in the series; sends him a sample and the asking price; reports on her improving health.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Discusses corrections of her manuscript " If I had a Million"; says she has another idea for a Christmas piece, if it is not too late.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Says she is late in answering due to illness; considers his Christmas suggestion.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok
Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Says she has moved to Long Island, which interrupted completion of a Christmas story; says she will keep him in mind for the future.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Says she has been overwhelmed by moving and the accumulation of work; promises to send him a piece by July.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Sends promised manuscript of a Christmas story at 6 cents per word; asks for immediate return if he is not pleased.]

did.unittitle: Ruth McEnery Stuartto Edward W. Bok

scopecontent.p: [Expresses holiday greetings; says she is working on a few stories about New Orleansand its plantation environs, where she spent time taking notes and sketching.]
[Includes biographical sketch which emphasizes that she was a friend of the "blacks."]
